title: James Hoge, veteran of big city tabloid newspaper wars, dies at 87
description: Following his career running the Chicago Sun-Times and the New York Daily News, Mr. Hoge revived the sleepy policy magazine Foreign Affairs.

title: Masked gunmen, an ambush, a chase: The execution of Hardeep Singh Nijjar
description: From the outset, the Sikh leader’s community in Surrey, British Columbia, believed the Indian government of Narendra Modi was behind his death.

title: A year of protests and repression in Iran
description: Today on “Post Reports,” a look at what has happened to Iranians in the year since massive protests swept the country. We hear from family members impacted by the government’s harsh crackdown and how Iran’s repression playbook works.

title: Zelensky accuses U.N. of inaction on Russia’s invasion of Ukraine
description: Ukrainian leader called for suspending Russia’s veto power over the U.N. Security Council as it stymies the most punitive proposals in response to the war.

title: Indian anger against Canada grows over perceived support of separatist Sikhs
description: The alleged assassination of a Sikh separatist is not unlike the plot of the spy thrillers showing Indian intelligence exploits that dominate the box office.

title: Sunak announces delay of climate goals to avoid ‘bankrupting’ Britons
description: Sunak’s critics, including members of his own party, said he was delaying inevitable sacrifices, while missing a critical window to contain carbon emissions.

title: Azerbaijan says agreement reached to halt fighting in Nagorno-Karabakh
description: Baku says that the unrecognized regional government has agreed to disband its military. Yerevan insists that it is not a party to the cease-fire.

title: Haiti wants foreign help against the gangs. The details worry all sides.
description: A painful history of destabilizing interventions looms over international efforts to pull together a security force.

title: How Canada got caught up in the Sikh struggle in India
description: Canada has found itself caught up in tensions between the Indian government and Sikhs over the Khalistan movement, which seeks an independent Sikh state.

title: King Charles making first state visit to France, with dinner at Versailles
description: Aspects of the trip will echo Queen Elizabeth II’s travels in France. But Charles’s interest in climate makes it a different sort of trip.

title: Russia-Ukraine war live updates: Zelensky to speak at U.N. Security Council in potential Lavrov showdown
description: The meeting follows Zelensky’s impassioned speech to world leaders at the U.N. General Assembly, in which he warned that “evil cannot be trusted.”

title: Biden and Lula try to find common cause, despite their differences
description: The leaders of the Western hemisphere’s two biggest democracies kicked off a day of speeches at the U.N. General Assembly.

title: What is the Khalistan separatist movement behind the India-Canada rift?
description: The killing of Hardeep Singh Nijjar in Canada — and Canada’s accusation that India’s government was involved — has brought renewed attention to the movement.
